scenarioDescription:
The HIP 116454 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HIP 116454 is a star with 0.81 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.72 times its radius. It is located 203.68 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 2 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HIP 116454 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HIP 116454 system


HIP 116454 b

HIP 116454 b was discovered by the K2 observatory, in 2015-02, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.09 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HIP 116454 b is 12.720 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HIP 116454 b is 2.466 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HIP 116454 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HIP 116454, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the K2.
name: HIP 116454 - System With 1 Exoplanet
